alert.note: Alert for Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued May 11 at 3:20AM MDT until May 12 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches, mainly above 9000 feet with higher snow totals possible above 10000 feet. Expect lower snow totals below 9000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Snowy Range. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 6 PM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Mountain travel may be be hazardous due to slippery roads and reduced visibilities in falling snow. Outdoor recreation could become dangerous to those caught unprepared for hazardous winter conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will be around 10000 feet during the day on Thursday, with mostly rain expected. Snow levels drop to 9000 feet by Friday morning, with the heaviest snow expected to fall Thursday night into Friday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
